text:
[Rama is reminded of Sita while talking to Lakshmana and gets immersed in grief.]

सातुनीलेनविधिवत्स्वारक्षासुसमाहिता ।

सागरस्योत्तरेतीरेसाधुसेनानिवेशिता ।।6.5.1।।
meaning: नीलेन: by Nila, विधिवत्: as per tradition, स्वारक्षा: their guard, सुसमाहिता: collected there, सा: that, सेना: army, सागरस्य: at the sea, उत्तरेतीरे: northern shore, साधु: successfully, निवेशिता: made to reside
translation: Nila settled the army successfully by making them reside on the northern shore of the sea, as per tradition.

meaning: तत्र: then, वानरपुङ्गवौ: the best of the vanaras, मैन्दश्च: Mainda and, द्विविदश्चैव: with Dwivida, उभौ: both, रक्षार्थम्: for safeguarding, सर्वतोदिशम्: in all directions, तांसेनाम्: that army, विचेरतुः moving about
translation: Dwivida and Mainda, the best of the vanaras, went about in all directions for safeguarding the army.

meaning: नदनदीपतेः lord of rivers and streams (the ocean), तीरे: shore, सेनायाम्: when the army, निविष्टायाम्: after having settled down, रामः Rama, पार्श्वस्थम्: beside, लक्ष्मणम्: at Lakshmana, दृष्टवा: seeing, वचनम्: these words, अब्रवीत्: spoke
translation: After the army had settled down on the shores of the lord of rivers (sea), Rama spoke to Lakshmana who stood beside him.

meaning: शोकः grief, गच्छता: goes, कालेन: as time passes, अपगच्छतिकिल: indeed progressing, कान्ताम्: beloved, अपश्यतः unable to see, ममच: for me, अहन्यहनि: day by day, वर्धते: increases
translation: As time passes, grief passes away. However my sorrow is progressing day by day being unable to see my beloved.

meaning: प्रिया: beloved, दूरे: at distance, मे: my, दुःखम्: grief, न: not, हृतेतिग: is abducted, वामे: or my, दुःखम्: sorrow, न: not, अस्याः her, वयः age, अतिवर्ततेहि: advancing, एतदेव: on this account, अनुशोचामि: I am feeling
translation: There is no grief in me that my beloved is at a distance, nor that she is taken away. Indeed her age is advancing. On this account I am feeling for her.

meaning: वात: oh Wind, कान्ता: beloved, यतः that place, वाहि: carry, ताम्: her, स्पृष्टवा: touched, मामपि: me too, स्पृश: touch, मे: my, गात्रसंस्पर्शः beloved's touch of my body like, त्वयि: by you, दृष्टिसमागमः contact with eyes, चन्द्रे: through moon
translation: O Wind Touch that place where my beloved is and touch me as it will give me the same feeling as my beloved's touch. Through the moon I will get her eye contact too.

meaning: ह्रियमाणा: being carried away, साप्रिया: she my beloved, हा नाथ इति: saying 'Ha beloved', अब्रवीत्: uttered इतियत्: this at that time, तत्: then, पीतम्: drunk, विषम् इव: like poison, आशये: my stomach, मे: me, गात्राणि: my body, दहति: is burning
translation: While being carried away that beloved of mine would have cried aloud saying 'oh my lord'. This thought is burning my body as though I have consumed poison in my stomach.

meaning: तद्वियोगेन्धनवता: the separation from her as fuel, तच्चिन्ता: the thought about her, विपुलार्चिषा: extensive flames, मदनाग्निना: by the fire of love, मे: my, शरीरम्: body, रात्रिंदिवम्: day and night, दह्यते: is burning
translation: The pain of separation from her is working as fuel and the thought about hers is engulfing me as extensive flame and burning my body day and night.

meaning: सौमित्रे: O Saumitri, सभवताविना: without you, अर्णवम्: into the ocean, अवगाह्य: plunging, स्वप्स्ये: will lie down, कथञ्चित्: probably, जले: in water, सुप्तम्: be sleeping, माम् प्रज्वलन्: to burn me, कामः god of love, नदहेत्: will not be able to consume me
translation: O Saumitri Plunging into water alone I will lie down. Probably then the god of love will not be able to consume me while sleeping.

meaning: अहम्: I, सा: her, वामोरूःच: of charming thighs, एकाम्: one, धरणिम्: land, आश्रितौइतियत्: this way seeking refuge, कामयानस्य: desiring, बहु: very much, एतेन: because of that, जीवितुम्: survival, शक्यम्: will be possible
translation: Me and Sita are seeking refuge on the same land indeed. Because of that only survival is possible for me, who is desiring for her very much.

meaning: ताम्: she, जीवन्तीम्: is living यत्: that, शृणोमि: I hearing, सोदकस्य: with water, केदारस्य: like a paddy field, उपस्नेहेन: getting wet, निरूदकः without water, केदारःइवजीवामि: am living like crop with water
translation: I am living only because of hearing about her survival, just as a paddy field without water gets wet by the proximity of a neighboring paddy field with water.

meaning: शत्रून्: enemies, विजित्य: winning, सुश्रोणीम्: lady with charming limbs, शतपत्रायतेक्षणाम्: of large beautiful eyes like lotus petals, स्फीताम्: abundance of, श्रियमिव: like fortune, सीताम्: Sita, कदानुखलु: when indeed, द्रक्ष्यामि: will be able to see
translation: When will I be able to win the enemies and see that Sita of charming limbs, with large and beautiful eyes like lotus petals, who is like an abundance of fortune?

meaning: चारुबिम्बोष्ठम्: beautiful lips like Bimba fruit, पद्ममिव: lotus like, तस्याः her, आननम्: face, ईषत्: slightly, उन्नाम्य: lifting, आतुरः one who is afflicted, रसायनमिव: like a sweet drink, कदा: when, पास्यामि: shall I drink?
translation: I do not know when I will lift her lotuslike face slightly and drink her beautiful lips like an afflicted man drinks sweet juice.

meaning: शिलष्ययन्त्या: desire to cling to, तस्याः her, सहितौ: along with, तुपीनौ: that plump, तालफलोपमौ: like the Palmyra fruit, सोत्कम्पौ: eagerly, तौ: those, स्तनौ: breasts, माम्: me, कदाखलु: when indeed, भजिष्यथ: will I enjoy
translation: I am eager to cling to her Palmyra fruits like plumpy breasts. Indeed when will I enjoy her embrace?

meaning: असितापाङ्गी: lady of dark eyes, मन्नाधा: has me as her lord, सा: she, रक्षोमध्यगता: in the midst of Rakshasas, सती: wife, नूनम्: surely, नाथहीनेव: emaciated being away from husband, त्रातारम्: protector, नाधिगच्छति: not getting
translation: That darkeyed lady (Sita), even though she has me (husband), is in the midst of rakshasas. Surely she is sad and emaciated being away from her husband, without a protector.

meaning: जनकराजस्य: king Janaka's, दुहिता: daughter, ममप्रिया: my beloved wife, दशरथस्य: Dasaratha's, स्नुषा: daughterinlaw, राक्षसीमध्यगा: in the midst of rakshasas, कथम्: how, शेते: sleeping
translation: My beloved is king Janaka's daughter and daughterinlaw of Dasaratha. Yet she is sleeping amid Rakshasas. How is it?

meaning: कदा: when will, शरत्स्तुइव: like in autumn season, शशिरेखा: crescent moon, नीलान्: dark, जलदान्: clouds, विधूयइव: like pushing, सा: she, अविक्षोभ्य: unshakeable, रक्षांसि: Rakshasas, विधूय: pushing, उत्पतिष्यति: will come out
translation: When will she come out pushing the Rakshasas like the crescent moon comes out pushing the dark clouds in autumn?

meaning: स्वभावतनुका: by nature slim, सीता: Sita, देशकालविपर्ययात्: due to unfavorable time and space, शोकेन: in grief, अनशनेन: due to abstaining from eating, नूनम्: surely, भूयः would be, तनुतरा: slender
translation: Sita who is by nature slim would surely be slender due to abstaining from eating, unfavorable time and location.

meaning: राक्षसेन्द्रस्य: rakshasa king's, निधायोरसि: into the chest, सायकान्: arrows, सीतां: Sita, प्रत्याहरिष्यामि: will get back, शोकमुत्सृज्य: casting off grief, मानसम्: from my mind, कदानु: indeed
translation: Indeed by shooting arrows into the chest of rakshasa king, when will I get back Sita and cast off grief from my mind.

meaning: साध्वी: chaste woman, सुरसुतोपमा: like the daughter of the gods, सीता: Sita, सोत्कण्ठा: with an excited longing, माम्: me, कण्ठम्: neck, आलम्ब्य clinging, कदाखलु: indeed, आनन्दजम्: of joy, जलम्: water(here tears), मोक्ष्यति: will shed
translation: When will Sita, the chaste woman, who is like the daughter of Gods, cling to my neck, and indeed shed tears of joy?

meaning: मैथिली: Mythili, विप्रयोगजम्: born out of separation, घोरम्: terrible, इमम्: this, शोकम्: grief, शुक्लेतरम्: soiled, वासःयथा: like a garment, कदा: when, सहसा: suddenly, विप्रमोक्ष्यामि: shall I abandon
translation: When will I get rid of this terrible grief of separation from Mythili for good, just like discarding a soiled garment?

meaning: धीमतः sagacious, तस्य: his, रामस्य: Rama's, तत्र: there, एवम्: in that way, विलपतः wailing, दिनक्षयात्: due to the ending of the day, मन्दवपुः dim, भास्करः sun's light, अस्तम्: west, उपागतः descended
translation: While sagacious Rama was wailing in that way the day came to an end with the sun descending to the west.

meaning: कमलपत्राक्षीम्: lotus petal eyed, सीताम्: Sita, स्मरन्: remembering, शोकाकुलीकृतः distracted with grief, रामः Rama, लक्ष्मणेन: by Lakshmana, आश्वासितः comforted, सन्ध्याम्: evening prayers, उपासत: set in
translation:
Remembering the lotus petal eyed Sita, Rama who was distracted with grief, comforted by Lakshmana offered evening prayers.
।।इत्यार्षेवाल्मीकीयेश्रीमद्रामायणेआदिकाव्येयुद्दकाण्डेपञ्चमस्सर्गः।।
This is the end of the fifth Sarga of Yuddhakanda of the first epic, the holy Ramayana composed by sage Valmiki.
